title: Grade 5
subject: Essential Elements for English Language Arts (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards Essential Elements for English Languange Arts

8D6E0B58CFC54F27844F468AE0836A91.description:
Use words acquired through conversations, being
read to, and during shared reading activities including
domain-specific words.

19C2974640E04A0CA8FAE9C70E67F426.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words that have
similar meanings.

4D8C63475A0645E9B4E47E70BB10933E.description:
Use simple, common idioms (e.g., You bet!, It’s a
deal., We’re cool.).

DA62706C026A46499D63EDE0A3FCE1B2.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word relationship
and use.

A78C4BEC21D443688FDBF3890C405C94.description:
Use frequently occurring root words (e.g., talk) and
the words that result when word endings are added
(e.g., talked, talking, talks).

A94DAF16D07841428DE074F3410F03EF.description:
Use sentence level context to determine which word
is missing from a content area text.

90C884FAA2B34AB4AAE6554E2B1F0391.description:
Communicate using complete sentences when
asked.

208D047AE88549FD84C72C0C74FE16B3.description:
Use language to achieve desired meaning when
communicating.

415A22CB0FE9460A938736C4EDF2B997.description:
Spell untaught word phonetically, drawing on
letter-sound relationships and common spelling
patterns.

A50F62969C0C46A591DC96E30AAB8CA5.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of
standard English.

09EDB32E4EAD49828D131474F0045333.description:
Use frequently occurring conjunctions: and, but,
or, for, because.

2F728E1A183847509F43DC06117A76D2.description:
Form and use the past tense of frequently
occurring irregular verbs (e.g., went, sat, ate,
and told).

9EF4FC5C9AA74BC9B23F841AF372ABAA.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and
usage when communicating.

18A56A91DD344E7C8FC1E7EA0DCC2E1B.description:
Differentiate between contexts that require
formal and informal communication.

1C86A8A267864D0CB2BAEAB340C8AD97.description:
Select or create audio recordings and
visual/tactile displays to enhance a presentation.

3D61F042EBBE40589A56B01E1FEB9DA2.description:
Report on a familiar topic or text or present an
opinion including related facts.

629DEC7EB4E647888A85EB7270134C54.description:
Identify the reasons and evidence supporting a
specific point.

B67DC267C4A04516A1A118B6FB37CB9A.description:
Identify the explicitly stated main idea of a text
presented orally or through other media.

786B47935406494B805CD8730D4D7ADB.description:
Make comments that contribute to the discussion
and link to the remarks of others.

76A44CC4979F477D956D2E227F110CF7.description:
Ask questions related to information in a
discussion.

A977B64CD7A142E28305604853C2388F.description: Carry out assigned role in a discussion.

B28C6ADCD68044CAB756FA659E23AAC7.description: Come to discussion prepared to share information.

8B9BDCFE44D0401D84D3C138DB932801.description:
Write routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes,
and audiences.

9238D383725A4140AC531C4135CAC022.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 5 Reading
Standards to informational texts (e.g., “Use specific
reasons and evidence for supporting specific points
in an informational text.”).

E409F27B1EF241C0A5BEED49C3B18AFD.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 5 Reading
Standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and
contrast two characters in the story.”).

8099F553A8984F12974C0D0A8CC29880.description:
Use information from literary and informational
text to support writing.

BA255FED05AC4719BA1116369F2D77A6.description:
Gather and sort relevant information on a topic
from print or digital sources into given categories.

887AE339C55C4410A448426E0DE5ED27.description:
Conduct short research projects using two or
more sources.

DB9D6696401842DDBE785BB1064A64EB.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

4723A5734B754ED3B3884FD8CDAAA39B.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use
technology, including the Internet, to produce writing while
interacting and collaborating with others.

5CEF749EEBFE4A8599FD4DE2E9E9CD8D.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, plan before writing and revise own writing.

95EE5745B8204E9EA1FBF0B41235A402.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate for an
explicitly stated task or purpose.

AF271B9F61DC4E7297694A6A5239AED8.description:
Write about an experience or event including three
or more events in sequence.

63EEF7957DA644FAAFD496893C0B01CB.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

218E400E7406436CB0DCE98426A9CBEA.description:
Provide facts, details, or other information related
to the topic.

CB2712623F044526B2E6F9F79491CC50.description:
Introduce a topic and write to convey information
about it including visual, tactual, or multimedia
information as appropriate.

6351ED4407854C18A94479CDDF653B22.description: Write to share information supported by details.

F4A71A91BF3E46A4BDF7128840D9CF01.description: Provide reasons to support the opinion.

1AF0CD8E063D495393D80C04223AD3F9.description:
Introduce a topic or text and state an opinion about
it.

18C0DCE961CB4AC984160C5243492072.description: Write opinions about topics or text.

35ADBE9DFB264F35A8C37FB90709DFD6.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word
recognition when reading.

D01DB4C59B89490B99D0D92CE1A92C97.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word
recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

1F6663C06F734CD29E675855DE40B94E.description:
Read common sight words and decode single
syllable words.

9B949E54F9554E4B83EC7BECD2360BFA.description: Use letter-sound knowledge to read words.

6948AC40470046E9A500F44A67328D81.description: Reading and Writing Standards: Foundational Skills

647070B95FAC4E2FBED4CCA3A0BBB5EF.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while
actively engaged in shared reading of history/social
studies, science, and technical texts.

CBF0430088C84E41ADBACE0E51BAF5F0.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

E2C1981266374F979D234656C2B6966F.description:
Compare and contrast details gained from two
texts on the same topic.

4F67E6F451394F10ADC428707E80C5B7.description:
Identify the relationship between a specific point
and supporting reasons in an informational text.

FC7088C0BD98463F93DAE27E90397FAE.description: Locate information in print or digital sources.

4806A3EC9D844226BF3B1688E265800E.description: Compare two books on the same topic.

F43FC9F1E03548778A3B3F69AC81CD1D.description:
Determine if a text tells about events, gives
directions, or provides information on a topic.

0FAE4C1525FB49D68AA3C2728D1C5823.description:
Determine the meanings of domain- specific
words and phrases.

E544D3C85F054CABBBCDB5123BF07839.description:
Compare two individuals, events, or ideas in a
text.

6579EC470B40402EBAE0BA9E3751831D.description:
Identify the main idea of a text when it is not
explicitly stated.

54AAB2B83D754294A2EAA9C0C196F143.description:
Identify words in the text to answer a question
about explicit information.

869227C238A54BDA840DE662FC8231DD.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while
engaged in individual or group reading of stories, dramas,
and poems.

D094D348A2DA424FB75C0B86CC3244FA.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

7C1E7759D659410B8A960CCBBC491126.description:
Compare stories, myths, or texts with similar
topics or themes.

976B108967A749DCA539E17A1B61258B.description:
Identify illustrations, tactual or multimedia
elements that add to understanding of a text.

CBFBE0DB168F47F5BE249AAFA0C2A9EE.description: Determine the point of view of the narrator.

C6DF7F5C81FF406AAD8B574D2DC8875F.description:
Identify a story element that undergoes change
from beginning to end.

413F69065F6E470C92A4AFF7D849E0D3.description: Determine the intended meaning of multimeaning words in a text.

E6B38AB771D44C99B09D4A9F9DEBCB46.description: Compare two characters in a familiar story.

B666004E115742499DB0F18AC9120F96.description:
Identify the central idea or theme of a story,
drama or poem.

B633CDCEBEBA45D1B3479A4AF796A188.description:
Identify words in the text to answer a question
about explicit information.
